entry.title: ABS-CBN closure will lead to more coronavirus infections: Salceda

media:group.media:title: ABS-CBN closure will lead to more coronavirus infections: Salceda
media:group.media:description: MANILA - A lawmaker on Wednesday said the National Telecommunications Commission’s move to close ABS-CBN network will lead to more novel coronavirus infections in the country.

entry.title: Staggered work hours, drone inspectons 'new normal' at Filinvest

media:group.media:title: Staggered work hours, drone inspectons 'new normal' at Filinvest
media:group.media:description: Dual shifting and staggered work hours for construction and digital tools for sales will be the new normal for real estate firm Filinvest Development Corp, its president and CEO said Wednesday.

entry.title: Duterte wants to thank ABS-CBN: spokesman | ANC

media:group.media:title: Duterte wants to thank ABS-CBN: spokesman | ANC
media:group.media:description:
President Rodrigo Duterte instructed his spokesperson to thank ABS-CBN Corp helping the Philippines battle the coronavirus pandemic, Malacañang, after regulators forced the country's top broadcaster off air over its stalled franchise renewal.

entry.title: NTC abused its power in ABS-CBN shutdown: analyst | ANC

media:group.media:title: NTC abused its power in ABS-CBN shutdown: analyst | ANC
media:group.media:description:
The National Telecommunications Commission abused its power when it ordered the closure of ABS-CBN Corp., the country's largest broadcast company, a lawyer said Wednesday.

entry.title: ABS-CBN closure not a repeat of 1972 shutdown: Panelo | ANC

media:group.media:title: ABS-CBN closure not a repeat of 1972 shutdown: Panelo | ANC
media:group.media:description:
President Rodrigo Duterte is not to blame for the shutdown of ABS-CBN Corp, his legal counsel said Wednesday, adding that the closure is not the same as the network's shutdown when the late dictator Ferdinand Marcos declared martial law in 1972.
